RevealedAmbush.synopsis: The player character points out that there are enemies preparing an ambush nearby
RevealedAmbush.how_to_trigger: Trigger an ambush that does not have a unique AD

Mirror.synopsis: Triggered when player clicks on a generic mirror in the game.

Mimic_Revealed.synopsis: Mimics use shapeshifting to pass as an ordinary object (like a chest or a door). This dialog is a generic AD after players succeed a perception check. They do not identify a mimic specifically, only a shapeshifted creature before interacting with it. As of 01.09.2021 was decided that the mimic-chest will stay a chest after being revealed. A vfx will be used and this AD. NOTE: mimic theoreticall can be any inanimate object, not only a chest.
Mimic_Revealed.how_to_trigger: Ask your local scripter to set up a mimic for you in a test level (it's not a very straightforward task atm). Or navigate to one of the mimics we have in Underdark in Act1. These are maintained by Andrew Tully. You have to succeed the perception check by walking near the mimic. Use console command `roll amazing` to ensure success.

CantTalk.synopsis: When the player tries to talk to an NPC but the player is mute (silenced/wildshaped/..)

CrimeAgainstPartOfTheTeam.synopsis: |A party member that has been recruited, but that is currently not in the party, was the victim of a crime committed by a party member (e.g. a player attacks a non-recruited origin in camp). Since they don't react while they are in party, they cannot react too strongly when not in the party for consistency. They will play this AD instead.|
CrimeAgainstPartOfTheTeam.how_to_trigger: Attack a non-recruited party member in camp, or pickpocket them.

Mimic_Surprised.synopsis: Triggered when surprised by a Mimic. This does not trigger if the player was successful in their perception check.
Mimic_Surprised.how_to_trigger: Triggered when surprised by a Mimic (failing the perception check).

CannotUsePlayerChest.synopsis: In multiplayer, each player has their own chest at camp that only they can access. This is the 'this is not my chest' PAD that plays when you try to open another player's chest.

HagGruel.synopsis: Player has clicked on a bowl of Hag broth. It's not very tasty.

LowHealth.synopsis: A player character lost HP and is now low on health. Meant to draw the player's attention to this fact, so they heal the character.
LowHealth.how_to_trigger: Damage a player character until they're under 20% of their original HP (threshold may be tweaked at some point).

Mirror_0.speaker: Player
Mirror_0.text: Perhaps I should paint the rest of my skull. What say you, Boo?

Mirror_1.speaker: Player
Mirror_1.text: No harm reflecting on one's appearance.

Mirror_2.speaker: Player
Mirror_2.text: Tsk. The sun is having an ill effect on my complexion.

Mirror_3.speaker: Player
Mirror_3.text: How did I go two hundred years without seeing that face?
Mirror_3.context: NodeContext: Vampire Lord - Admiring himself in a mirror

Mirror_4.speaker: Player
Mirror_4.text: A man looks in, a devil looks back. I might never get used to it.

Mirror_5.speaker: Player
Mirror_5.text: A bruise here, a scratch there. Nothing a good night's sleep couldn't cure.

Mirror_8.speaker: Player
Mirror_8.context: NodeContext: The joyful confidence of Karlach spotting herself in a mirror.

Mirror_9.speaker: Player
Mirror_9.text: Embrace pride, reject vanity. Especially when gazing at your own reflection.

Mirror_10.speaker: Player
Mirror_10.text: Looking perfect as always. I assume.

Mirror_11.speaker: Player
Mirror_11.text: It's... me. The ritual gave me back my reflection - after all these years...
Mirror_11.context: NodeContext: Vampire Lord - seeing his face in a mirror for the first time in 200 years

Mirror_6.speaker: Player
Mirror_6.text: Hello again. Gods, I missed you.
Mirror_6.context: NodeContext: Vampire Lord - seeing his face in a mirror for the first time in 200 years

Mirror_12.speaker: Player
Mirror_12.text: This body can take a little more punishment yet.

Mirror_13.speaker: Player
Mirror_13.text: I've looked worse. But I've definitely looked better.

Mirror_14.speaker: Player
Mirror_14.text: Not bad, for a druid of my vintage.

Mimic_Revealed_0.speaker: Player
Mimic_Revealed_0.text: That is not what it seems. I see you, shapeshifter.

CrimeAgainstPartOfTheTeam_0.speaker: Player
CrimeAgainstPartOfTheTeam_0.text: Surely you have something better to do.
